p: The picobirnavirus has been detected in the feces of animals or humans, introducing or not a diarrhea, sometimes in the presence of other enteric pathogens, and is as well qualified as opportunistic virus ( Gallimore et al., 1995, Rosen et al., 2000, BÃ¡nyai et al., 2003, Fregolente et al., 2009). The picobirnaviruses are excreted in the feces during a long period (45 days to 7 months) ( Kapusinszky et al., 2012).
